bill.title: An Act To Achieve the Savings Required under Part F of the Biennial Budget and To Change Certain Provisions of the Law for Fiscal Years Ending June 30, 2014 and June 30, 2015
bill.description: An Act To Achieve the Savings Required under Part F of the Biennial Budget and To Change Certain Provisions of the Law for Fiscal Years Ending June 30, 2014 and June 30, 2015

history.action: Reported by Representative ROTUNDO for the Joint Standing Committee on Appropriations and Financial Affairs pursuant to Public Law 2013, chapter 368, Part F, section 3.
Report was READ and ACCEPTED.
The Bill was READ ONCE.
Under suspension of the rules, the Bill was given its SECOND READING without REFERENCE to the Committee on Bills in the Second Reading.
On motion of Representative McCABE of Skowhegan, TABLED pending PASSAGE TO BE ENGROSSED.
Later today assigned.
Unfinished Business
Speaker laid before the House
On motion of Representative ROTUNDO of Lewiston, House Amendment "B" (H-833) was READ and ADOPTED.
On motion of Representative STUCKEY of Portland, House Amendment "A" (H-832) was READ.
On motion of Representative ROTUNDO of Lewiston, House Amendment "A" (H-832) was INDEFINITELY POSTPONED.
ROLL CALL NO. 707 (Yeas 115 - Nays 26 - Absent 10 - Excused 0)
On motion of Representative LOCKMAN of Amherst, House Amendment "C" (H-834) was READ. (Roll Call Ordedred)
On motion of Representative ROTUNDO of Lewiston, House Amendment "C" (H-834) was INDEFINITELY POSTPONED.
ROLL CALL NO. 708 (Yeas 97 - Nays 43 - Absent 11 - Excused 0)
Subsequently, the Bill was PASSED TO BE ENGROSSED as Amended by House Amendment "B" (H-833).
Sent for concurrence. ORDERED SENT FORTHWITH.
Report READ and ACCEPTED , in concurrence.
READ ONCE
House Amendment "B" (H-833) READ and ADOPTED , in concurrence.
Under suspension of the Rules, READ A SECOND TIME  PASSED TO BE ENGROSSED AS AMENDED BY  House Amendment "B" (H-833) , in concurrence.
PASSED TO BE ENACTED.
ROLL CALL NO. 709 (Yeas 136 - Nays 8 - Absent 7 - Excused 0)
Sent for concurrence. ORDERED SENT FORTHWITH.
PASSED TO BE ENACTED - Emergency - 2/3 Elected Required, in concurrence.
Roll Call Ordered Roll Call # 583 35 Yeas - 0 Nays- 0 Excused - 0 Absent PREVAILED

This Bill, having been returned by the Governor, together with objections to the same pursuant to the provisions of the Constitution of the State of Maine, after reconsideration, the House proceeded to vote on the question: "Shall this Bill become a law notwithstanding the objections of the Governor?"

ROLL CALL NO. 749V 134 having voted in the affirmative and 12 in the negative, with 5 being absent, and accordingly it was the vote of the House that the Bill become a law notwithstanding the objections of the Governor, since two-thirds of the members of the House so voted.
Sent for concurrence. ORDERED SENT FORTHWITH.

LD 1858 In Senate, May 1, 2014, this Bill, having been returned by the Governor, together with objections to the same pursuant to the provisions of the Constitution of the State of Maine, after reconsideration, the Senate proceeded to vote on the question: "Shall this Bill become a law notwithstanding the objections of the Governor?" 35 In the Affirmative and 0 In the Negative , accordingly it was the vote of the Senate that the Bill become law and the VETO was OVERRIDDEN.

LD 1747 In Senate, May 1, 2014, this Bill, having been returned by the Governor, together with objections to the same pursuant to the provisions of the Constitution of the State of Maine, after reconsideration, the Senate proceeded to vote on the question: "Shall this Bill become a law notwithstanding the objections of the Governor?" 28 in the Affirmative and 7 in the Negative , accordingly it was the vote of the Senate that the Bill become law and the VETO was OVERRIDDEN.
Roll Call # 634
35 Yeas - 0 Nays- 0 Excused - 0 Absent
